member.name: T:System.Net.AuthenticationManager
member.summary: Manages the authentication modules called during the client authentication process.

member.name: M:System.Net.AuthenticationManager.Authenticate(System.String,System.Net.WebRequest,System.Net.ICredentials)
member.summary: Calls each registered authentication module to find the first module that can respond to the authentication request.
member.param: The challenge returned by the Internet resource.
The that initiated the authentication challenge.
The associated with this request.
member.returns: An instance of the class containing the result of the authorization attempt. If there is no authentication module to respond to the challenge, this method returns null.
member.exception: challenge is null. -or- request is null. -or- credentials is null.

member.name: P:System.Net.AuthenticationManager.CredentialPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets the credential policy to be used for resource requests made using the class.
member.returns: An object that implements the interface that determines whether credentials are sent with requests. The default value is null.

member.name: P:System.Net.AuthenticationManager.CustomTargetNameDictionary
member.summary: Gets the dictionary that contains Service Principal Names (SPNs) that are used to identify hosts during Kerberos authentication for requests made using and its derived classes.
member.returns: A writable that contains the SPN values for keys composed of host information.

member.name: M:System.Net.AuthenticationManager.PreAuthenticate(System.Net.WebRequest,System.Net.ICredentials)
member.summary: Preauthenticates a request.
member.param: A to an Internet resource.
The associated with the request.
member.returns: An instance of the class if the request can be preauthenticated; otherwise, null. If credentials is null, this method returns null.
member.exception: request is null.

member.summary: Registers an authentication module with the authentication manager.
member.param: The to register with the authentication manager.
member.exception: authenticationModule is null.

member.name: P:System.Net.AuthenticationManager.RegisteredModules
member.summary: Gets a list of authentication modules that are registered with the authentication manager.
member.returns: An that enables the registered authentication modules to be read.

member.name: M:System.Net.AuthenticationManager.Unregister(System.Net.IAuthenticationModule)
member.summary: Removes the specified authentication module from the list of registered modules.
member.param: The to remove from the list of registered modules.
member.exception: authenticationModule is null.
The specified is not registered.

member.name: M:System.Net.AuthenticationManager.Unregister(System.String)
member.summary: Removes authentication modules with the specified authentication scheme from the list of registered modules.
member.param: The authentication scheme of the module to remove.
member.exception: authenticationScheme is null.
A module for this authentication scheme is not registered.

member.name: T:System.Net.Authorization
member.summary: Contains an authentication message for an Internet server.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with the specified authorization message.
member.param: The encrypted authorization message expected by the server.

member.name: M:System.Net.Authorization.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with the specified authorization message and completion status.
member.param: The encrypted authorization message expected by the server.
The completion status of the authorization attempt. true if the authorization attempt is complete; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.Net.Authorization.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with the specified authorization message, completion status, and connection group identifier.
member.param: The encrypted authorization message expected by the server.
The completion status of the authorization attempt. true if the authorization attempt is complete; otherwise, false.
A unique identifier that can be used to create private client-server connections that are bound only to this authentication scheme.

member.name: P:System.Net.Authorization.Complete
member.summary: Gets the completion status of the authorization.
member.returns: true if the authentication process is complete; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Net.Authorization.ConnectionGroupId
member.summary: Gets a unique identifier for user-specific connections.
member.returns: A unique string that associates a connection with an authenticating entity.

member.name: P:System.Net.Authorization.Message
member.summary: Gets the message returned to the server in response to an authentication challenge.
member.returns: The message that will be returned to the server in response to an authentication challenge.

member.name: P:System.Net.Authorization.MutuallyAuthenticated
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether mutual authentication occurred.
member.returns: true if both client and server were authenticated; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Net.Authorization.ProtectionRealm
member.summary: Gets or sets the prefix for Uniform Resource Identifiers (URIs) that can be authenticated with the property.
member.returns: An array of strings that contains URI prefixes.

member.name: T:System.Net.FtpStatusCode
member.summary: Specifies the status codes returned for a File Transfer Protocol (FTP) operation.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.AccountNeeded
member.summary: Specifies that a user account on the server is required.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.ActionAbortedLocalProcessingError
member.summary: Specifies that an error occurred that prevented the request action from completing.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.ActionAbortedUnknownPageType
member.summary: Specifies that the requested action cannot be taken because the specified page type is unknown. Page types are described in RFC 959 Section 3.1.2.3

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.ActionNotTakenFilenameNotAllowed
member.summary: Specifies that the requested action cannot be performed on the specified file.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.ActionNotTakenFileUnavailable
member.summary: Specifies that the requested action cannot be performed on the specified file because the file is not available.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.ActionNotTakenFileUnavailableOrBusy
member.summary: Specifies that the requested action cannot be performed on the specified file because the file is not available or is being used.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.ActionNotTakenInsufficientSpace
member.summary: Specifies that the requested action cannot be performed because there is not enough space on the server.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.ArgumentSyntaxError
member.summary: Specifies that one or more command arguments has a syntax error.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.BadCommandSequence
member.summary: Specifies that the sequence of commands is not in the correct order.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.CantOpenData
member.summary: Specifies that the data connection cannot be opened.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.ClosingControl
member.summary: Specifies that the server is closing the control connection.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.ClosingData
member.summary: Specifies that the server is closing the data connection and that the requested file action was successful.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.CommandExtraneous
member.summary: Specifies that the command is not implemented by the server because it is not needed.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.CommandNotImplemented
member.summary: Specifies that the command is not implemented by the FTP server.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.CommandOK
member.summary: Specifies that the command completed successfully.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.CommandSyntaxError
member.summary: Specifies that the command has a syntax error or is not a command recognized by the server.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.ConnectionClosed
member.summary: Specifies that the connection has been closed.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.DataAlreadyOpen
member.summary: Specifies that the data connection is already open and the requested transfer is starting.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.DirectoryStatus
member.summary: Specifies the status of a directory.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.EnteringPassive
member.summary: Specifies that the server is entering passive mode.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.FileActionAborted
member.summary: Specifies that the requested action cannot be performed.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.FileActionOK
member.summary: Specifies that the requested file action completed successfully.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.FileCommandPending
member.summary: Specifies that the requested file action requires additional information.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.FileStatus
member.summary: Specifies the status of a file.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.LoggedInProceed
member.summary: Specifies that the user is logged in and can send commands.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.NeedLoginAccount
member.summary: Specifies that the server requires a login account to be supplied.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.NotLoggedIn
member.summary: Specifies that login information must be sent to the server.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.OpeningData
member.summary: Specifies that the server is opening the data connection.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.PathnameCreated
member.summary: Specifies that the requested path name was created.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.RestartMarker
member.summary: Specifies that the response contains a restart marker reply. The text of the description that accompanies this status contains the user data stream marker and the server marker.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.SendPasswordCommand
member.summary: Specifies that the server expects a password to be supplied.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.SendUserCommand
member.summary: Specifies that the server is ready for a user login operation.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.ServerWantsSecureSession
member.summary: Specifies that the server accepts the authentication mechanism specified by the client, and the exchange of security data is complete.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.ServiceNotAvailable
member.summary: Specifies that the service is not available.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.ServiceTemporarilyNotAvailable
member.summary: Specifies that the service is not available now; try your request later.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.SystemType
member.summary: Specifies the system type name using the system names published in the Assigned Numbers document published by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority.

member.name: F:System.Net.FtpStatusCode.Undefined
member.summary: Included for completeness, this value is never returned by servers.

member.name: T:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus
member.summary: Defines status codes for the class.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.CacheEntryNotFound
member.summary: The specified cache entry was not found.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.ConnectFailure
member.summary: The remote service point could not be contacted at the transport level.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.ConnectionClosed
member.summary: The connection was prematurely closed.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.KeepAliveFailure
member.summary: The connection for a request that specifies the Keep-alive header was closed unexpectedly.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.MessageLengthLimitExceeded
member.summary: A message was received that exceeded the specified limit when sending a request or receiving a response from the server.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.NameResolutionFailure
member.summary: The name resolver service could not resolve the host name.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.Pending
member.summary: An internal asynchronous request is pending.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.PipelineFailure
member.summary: The request was a pipelined request and the connection was closed before the response was received.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.ProtocolError
member.summary: The response received from the server was complete but indicated a protocol-level error. For example, an HTTP protocol error such as 401 Access Denied would use this status.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.ProxyNameResolutionFailure
member.summary: The name resolver service could not resolve the proxy host name.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.ReceiveFailure
member.summary: A complete response was not received from the remote server.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.RequestCanceled
member.summary: The request was canceled, the method was called, or an unclassifiable error occurred. This is the default value for .

member.name: F:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.RequestProhibitedByCachePolicy
member.summary: The request was not permitted by the cache policy. In general, this occurs when a request is not cacheable and the effective policy prohibits sending the request to the server. You might receive this status if a request method implies the presence of a request body, a request method requires direct interaction with the server, or a request contains a conditional header.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.RequestProhibitedByProxy
member.summary: This request was not permitted by the proxy.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.SecureChannelFailure
member.summary: An error occurred while establishing a connection using SSL.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.SendFailure
member.summary: A complete request could not be sent to the remote server.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.ServerProtocolViolation
member.summary: The server response was not a valid HTTP response.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.Success
member.summary: No error was encountered.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.Timeout
member.summary: No response was received during the time-out period for a request.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.TrustFailure
member.summary: A server certificate could not be validated.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.UnknownError
member.summary: An exception of unknown type has occurred.

member.name: T:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.File
member.summary: Represents the types of file protocol methods that can be used with a FILE request. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.File.DownloadFile
member.summary: Represents the FILE GET protocol method that is used to retrieve a file from a specified location.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.File.UploadFile
member.summary: Represents the FILE PUT protocol method that is used to copy a file to a specified location.

member.name: T:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp
member.summary: Represents the types of FTP protocol methods that can be used with an FTP request. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.AppendFile
member.summary: Represents the FTP APPE protocol method that is used to append a file to an existing file on an FTP server.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.DeleteFile
member.summary: Represents the FTP DELE protocol method that is used to delete a file on an FTP server.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.DownloadFile
member.summary: Represents the FTP RETR protocol method that is used to download a file from an FTP server.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.GetDateTimestamp
member.summary: Represents the FTP MDTM protocol method that is used to retrieve the date-time stamp from a file on an FTP server.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.GetFileSize
member.summary: Represents the FTP SIZE protocol method that is used to retrieve the size of a file on an FTP server.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.ListDirectory
member.summary: Represents the FTP NLIST protocol method that gets a short listing of the files on an FTP server.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.ListDirectoryDetails
member.summary: Represents the FTP LIST protocol method that gets a detailed listing of the files on an FTP server.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.MakeDirectory
member.summary: Represents the FTP MKD protocol method creates a directory on an FTP server.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.PrintWorkingDirectory
member.summary: Represents the FTP PWD protocol method that prints the name of the current working directory.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.RemoveDirectory
member.summary: Represents the FTP RMD protocol method that removes a directory.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.Rename
member.summary: Represents the FTP RENAME protocol method that renames a directory.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.UploadFile
member.summary: Represents the FTP STOR protocol method that uploads a file to an FTP server.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Ftp.UploadFileWithUniqueName
member.summary: Represents the FTP STOU protocol that uploads a file with a unique name to an FTP server.

member.name: T:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Http
member.summary: Represents the types of HTTP protocol methods that can be used with an HTTP request.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Http.Connect
member.summary: Represents the HTTP CONNECT protocol method that is used with a proxy that can dynamically switch to tunneling, as in the case of SSL tunneling.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Http.Get
member.summary: Represents an HTTP GET protocol method.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Http.Head
member.summary: Represents an HTTP HEAD protocol method. The HEAD method is identical to GET except that the server only returns message-headers in the response, without a message-body.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Http.MkCol
member.summary: Represents an HTTP MKCOL request that creates a new collection (such as a collection of pages) at the location specified by the request-Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

member.name: F:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Http.Post
member.summary: Represents an HTTP POST protocol method that is used to post a new entity as an addition to a URI.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebRequestMethods.Http.Put
member.summary: Represents an HTTP PUT protocol method that is used to replace an entity identified by a URI.

member.name: T:System.Net.Cache.HttpCacheAgeControl
member.summary: Specifies the meaning of time values that control caching behavior for resources obtained using objects.

member.name: F:System.Net.Cache.HttpCacheAgeControl.MaxAge
member.summary: Content can be taken from the cache until it is older than the age specified with this value.

member.name: F:System.Net.Cache.HttpCacheAgeControl.MaxAgeAndMaxStale
member.summary: and .

member.name: F:System.Net.Cache.HttpCacheAgeControl.MaxAgeAndMinFresh
member.summary: and .

member.name: F:System.Net.Cache.HttpCacheAgeControl.MaxStale
member.summary: Content can be taken from the cache after it has expired, until the time specified with this value elapses.

member.name: F:System.Net.Cache.HttpCacheAgeControl.MinFresh
member.summary: Content can be taken from the cache if the time remaining before expiration is greater than or equal to the time specified with this value.

member.name: F:System.Net.Cache.HttpCacheAgeControl.None
member.summary: For internal use only. The Framework will throw an if you try to use this member.

member.name: T:System.Net.Cache.HttpRequestCacheLevel
member.summary: Specifies caching behavior for resources obtained using the Hypertext Transfer protocol (HTTP).

member.name: F:System.Net.Cache.HttpRequestCacheLevel.BypassCache
member.summary: Satisfies a request by using the server. No entries are taken from caches, added to caches, or removed from caches between the client and server. No entries are taken from caches, added to caches, or removed from caches between the client and server. This is the default cache behavior specified in the machine configuration file that ships with the .NET Framework.

member.name: F:System.Net.Cache.HttpRequestCacheLevel.CacheIfAvailable
member.summary: Satisfies a request for a resource from the cache if the resource is available; otherwise, sends a request for a resource to the server. If the requested item is available in any cache between the client and the server, the request might be satisfied by the intermediate cache.

member.name: F:System.Net.Cache.HttpRequestCacheLevel.CacheOnly
member.summary: Satisfies a request using the locally cached resource; does not send a request for an item that is not in the cache. When this cache policy level is specified, a exception is thrown if the item is not in the client cache.

member.name: F:System.Net.Cache.HttpRequestCacheLevel.CacheOrNextCacheOnly
member.summary: Satisfies a request for a resource either from the local computer's cache or a remote cache on the local area network. If the request cannot be satisfied, a exception is thrown. In the HTTP caching protocol, this is achieved using the only-if-cached cache control directive.

member.name: F:System.Net.Cache.HttpRequestCacheLevel.Default
member.summary: Satisfies a request for a resource either by using the cached copy of the resource or by sending a request for the resource to the server. The action taken is determined by the current cache policy and the age of the content in the cache. This is the cache level that should be used by most applications.

member.name: F:System.Net.Cache.HttpRequestCacheLevel.NoCacheNoStore
member.summary: Never satisfies a request by using resources from the cache and does not cache resources. If the resource is present in the local cache, it is removed. This policy level indicates to intermediate caches that they should remove the resource. In the HTTP caching protocol, this is achieved using the no-cache cache control directive.

member.name: F:System.Net.Cache.HttpRequestCacheLevel.Refresh
member.summary: Satisfies a request by using the server or a cache other than the local cache. Before the request can be satisfied by an intermediate cache, that cache must revalidate its cached entry with the server. In the HTTP caching protocol, this is achieved using the max-age = 0 cache control directive and the no-cache Pragma header.

member.name: F:System.Net.Cache.HttpRequestCacheLevel.Reload
member.summary: Satisfies a request by using the server. The response might be saved in the cache. In the HTTP caching protocol, this is achieved using the no-cache cache control directive and the no-cache Pragma header.

member.name: F:System.Net.Cache.HttpRequestCacheLevel.Revalidate
member.summary: Compares the copy of the resource in the cache with the copy on the server. If the copy on the server is newer, it is used to satisfy the request and replaces the copy in the cache. If the copy in the cache is the same as the server copy, the cached copy is used. In the HTTP caching protocol, this is achieved using a conditional request.

member.summary: Defines an application's caching requirements for resources obtained by using objects.
